data.title: Utah Jazz hosting 2000s-themed 'Decade Night' during game against Charlotte Hornets
data.meta_description: The Utah Jazz is preparing the Delta Center for a 2000s-themed "Decade Night" as part of their celebration recognizing 50 seasons of the franchise.Fans attendin
data.text:
The Utah Jazz is preparing the Delta Center for a 2000s-themed "Decade Night" as part of their celebration recognizing 50 seasons of the franchise.

Fans attending the game against the Charlotte Hornets can expect special in-arena entertainment and limited-edition Jazz gear, with only 50 items available for each special merchandise.

According to a news release by Jazz officials, there are only 50 items each so you should expect them to sell out quick.

MORE:

"Decade Night" is the fourth of five celebrations recognizing 50 seasons of the franchise, presented by Delta Air Lines.

During the 2000s, the Jazz underwent a transition period following the departure of NBA legends Karl Malone and John Stockton.

Under the guidance of Hall of Fame head coach Jerry Sloan, the team welcomed new stars like Deron Williams and Carlos Boozer, who played key roles in the Jazz's return.

ALSO:

The team made notable playoff appearances, including reaching the Western Conference Finals in 2007.

As part of the Decade Night festivities, Jazz alumni from the 2000s, including Carlos Boozer, Andrei Kirilenko, Mehmet "Memo" Okur, and Deron Williams, will join fellow alumni and current TV analyst Thurl Bailey for a special alt-cast on Jazz+.
